search_parameters.q: Selection without Discrimination: An Analysis of the ASA Minority Fellowship Program Carey, Phillip And Others Sociology of Education

search_information.query_displayed: Selection without Discrimination: An Analysis of the ASA Minority Fellowship Program Carey, Phillip And Others Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Selection without Discrimination: An Analysis of the ASA Minority Fellowship Program
organic_results.snippet: The acquisition of higher education by minority group members as an effective means to combat historical racial problems, has been advocated by educators and social scientists for decades. This report analyzes the dynamics of a program designed to aid minority graduate students obtain the doctors degree in sociology at a university of their choice. The analysis emphasized the equitable nature of the process used to select award recipients. The results indicate that the fellowships awarded were distributed equally among the sexes when …

publication_info.summary: P Carey, S McLaughlin, M Patton, M Tavakoliyazdi - Sociology of Education, 1977 - JSTOR
